page.title: 08BELTON VILLAGE
page.content: Belton was, until 1970 a tiny village on the edge of the Waveney marshes.It had no through route and lost its railway station under the 'Beeching Axe'.The Norfolk Structure Plan concentrated East Norfolk development South of Gt.Yarmouth and during the 1970's Belton grew rapidly.Today its population is over four thousand,yet it lacks nearly all the amenities normally associated with a settlement of this size.The village probably has the lowest property values of the area and consequently has many young families purchasing their first homes. Belton's two primary school are not experiencing the falling roll numbers general elsewhere in East Norfolk. There are almost no full-time jobs within the village and most people commute by the almost essential private car.
